recipe.title: Chocolate Brownies
recipe.description: Fudgy, rich chocolate brownies with a crackly top

steps.descr: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F), line a baking tin
steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F), line a baking tin

on_enter.say: Right, let's preheat the oven to one hundred eighty degrees celsius, that's about three hundred fifty degrees fahrenheit, and line a baking tin with parchment paper. This will help those lovely brownies come out easily.
Now, let's melt the chocolate and butter together. You want it smooth and glossy. Keep stirring so it doesn't catch!
Brilliant! Now let's whisk in the sugar until it's all combined. It should look thick and glossy.

steps.descr: Beat in eggs one at a time
steps.instructions: Beat in eggs one at a time

on_enter.say: Let's beat in the eggs, one at a time. This will help create that lovely fudgy texture we're after.

steps.descr: Fold in flour, cocoa, and salt
steps.instructions: Fold in flour, cocoa, and salt

on_enter.say: Now gently fold in the flour, cocoa powder, and a pinch of salt. Be careful not to overmix, we want to keep it nice and light.

steps.descr: Pour into tin and bake for 25-30 minutes
steps.instructions: Pour into tin and bake for 25-30 minutes

on_enter.say: Let's pour the mixture into the prepared tin and pop it into the oven. We'll bake it for twenty-five to thirty minutes. You want the top to be crackly and the inside still a bit gooey.

steps.descr: Cool completely before cutting into squares
steps.instructions: Cool completely before cutting into squares

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Let the brownies cool completely in the tin before cutting them into squares. This will give you those perfect, clean edges.

notes.text:
Don't overbake - they should be slightly gooey
A skewer should come out with moist crumbs
Let cool fully for clean cuts
